If true, email will be sent upon creation.
The email subject line.
The plain text body of the email. Note that only text or html can be supplied, not both.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SearchCriteria class.
member.param: The full email address from which the target email was sent.
The full email address to which the target email was sent.
The value to seek within the target email's subject line.
The value to seek within the target email's HTML or text body.
If set to ALL (default), then only results that match all specified criteria will be returned. If set to ANY, results that match any of the specified criteria will be returned.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.Get(System.String,Mailosaur.Models.SearchCriteria,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Retrieve a message using search criteria
member.remarks: Returns as soon as a message matching the specified search criteria is found. This is the most efficient method of looking up a message.
member.param: The identifier of the server hosting the message.
The search criteria to use in order to find a match.
Specify how long to wait for a matching result (in milliseconds).
Limits results to only messages received after this date/time.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.GetAsync(System.String,Mailosaur.Models.SearchCriteria,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Retrieve a message using search criteria
member.remarks: Returns as soon as a message matching the specified search criteria is found. This is the most efficient method of looking up a message.
member.param: The identifier of the server hosting the message.
The search criteria to use in order to find a match.
Specify how long to wait for a matching result (in milliseconds).
Limits results to only messages received after this date/time.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.GetById(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a message

member.param: The identifier of the email message to be retrieved.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.GetByIdAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a message
member.remarks: Retrieves the detail for a single email message. Simply supply the unique identifier for the required message.
member.param: The identifier of the email message to be retrieved.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: a message
member.remarks: Permanently deletes a message. This operation cannot be undone. Also deletes any attachments related to the message.
member.param: The identifier of the message to be deleted.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.DeleteAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Delete a message
member.remarks: Permanently deletes a message. This operation cannot be undone. Also deletes any attachments related to the message.
member.param: The identifier of the message to be deleted.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.List(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: List all messages
member.remarks: Returns a list of your messages in summary form. The summaries are returned sorted by received date, with the most recently-received messages appearing first.
member.param: The identifier of the server hosting the messages.
Used in conjunction with `itemsPerPage` to support pagination.
A limit on the number of results to be returned per page. Can be set between 1 and 1000 items, the default is 50.
Limits results to only messages received after this date/time.
Optionally limits results based on the direction (`Sent` or `Received`), with the default being `Received`.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.ListAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: List all messages
member.remarks: Returns a list of your messages in summary form. The summaries are returned sorted by received date, with the most recently-received messages appearing first.
member.param: The identifier of the server hosting the messages.
Used in conjunction with `itemsPerPage` to support pagination.
A limit on the number of results to be returned per page. Can be set between 1 and 1000 items, the default is 50.
Limits results to only messages received after this date/time.
Optionally limits results based on the direction (`Sent` or `Received`), with the default being `Received`.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.DeleteAll(System.String)
member.summary: Delete all messages
member.remarks: Permanently deletes all messages held by the specified server. This operation cannot be undone. Also deletes any attachments related to each message.
member.param: The identifier of the server to be emptied.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.DeleteAllAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Delete all messages
member.remarks: Permanently deletes all messages held by the specified server. This operation cannot be undone. Also deletes any attachments related to each message.
member.param: The identifier of the server to be emptied.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.Search(System.String,Mailosaur.Models.SearchCriteria,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Search for messages
member.remarks: Returns a list of messages matching the specified search criteria, in summary form. The messages are returned sorted by received date, with the most recently-received messages appearing first.
member.param: The identifier of the server hosting the messages.
The search criteria to match results against.
Used in conjunction with `itemsPerPage` to support pagination.
A limit on the number of results to be returned per page. Can be set between 1 and 1000 items, the default is 50.
Specify how long to wait for a matching result (in milliseconds).
Limits results to only messages received after this date/time.
When set to false, an error will not be throw if timeout is reached (default: true).
Optionally limits results based on the direction (`Sent` or `Received`), with the default being `Received`.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.SearchAsync(System.String,Mailosaur.Models.SearchCriteria,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Search for messages
member.remarks: Returns a list of messages matching the specified search criteria, in summary form. The messages are returned sorted by received date, with the most recently-received messages appearing first.
member.param: The identifier of the server hosting the messages.
The search criteria to match results against.
Used in conjunction with `itemsPerPage` to support pagination.
A limit on the number of results to be returned per page. Can be set between 1 and 1000 items, the default is 50.
Specify how long to wait for a matching result (in milliseconds).
Limits results to only messages received after this date/time.
When set to false, an error will not be throw if timeout is reached (default: true).
Optionally limits results based on the direction (`Sent` or `Received`), with the default being `Received`.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.Create(System.String,Mailosaur.Models.MessageCreateOptions)
member.summary: Create a message
member.remarks: Creates a new message that can be sent to a verified email address. This is useful in scenarios where you want an email to trigger a workflow in your product.
member.param: The identifier of the server to create the message in.
The options with which to create the message.
member.exception: Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code
member.return: A response object containing the response body and response headers.

member.summary: Create a message

member.param: The identifier of the server to create the message in.
The options with which to create the message.
member.exception: Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code
member.return: A response object containing the response body and response headers.

member.name: M:Mailosaur.Operations.Messages.Forward(System.String,Mailosaur.Models.MessageForwardOptions)
member.summary: Forward an email
member.remarks: Forwards the specified email to a verified email address.
member.param: The identifier of the email to forward.
The options with which to forward the email.
member.exception: Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code
